nodes.documentation:
@dev The BancorX contract allows cross chain token transfers.

There are two processes that take place in the contract -
- Initiate a cross chain transfer to a target blockchain (locks tokens from the caller account on Ethereum)
- Report a cross chain transfer initiated on a source blockchain (releases tokens to an account on Ethereum)

Reporting cross chain transfers works similar to standard multisig contracts, meaning that multiple
callers are required to report a transfer before tokens are released to the target account.
nodes.name: BancorX
TokensLock
TokensRelease
XTransfer
TxReport
XTransferComplete

Reporting cross chain transfers works similar to standard multisig contracts, meaning that multiple

acceptOwnership().details: used by a new owner to accept an ownership transfer

enableReporting(bool).details: allows the owner enable/disable the reportTransaction method

params._enable: true to enable, false to disable

enableXTransfers(bool).details: allows the owner enable/disable the xTransfer method

params._enable: true to enable, false to disable

getCurrentLockLimit().details: method for calculating current lock limit
getCurrentLockLimit().return: the current maximum limit of tokens that can be locked

getCurrentReleaseLimit().details: method for calculating current release limit
getCurrentReleaseLimit().return: the current maximum limit of tokens that can be released

getXTransferAmount(uint256,address).details: gets x transfer amount by xTransferId (not txId)

params._xTransferId: unique (if non zero) pre-determined id (unlike _txId which is determined after the transactions been broadcasted)

getXTransferAmount(uint256,address).return: amount that was sent in xTransfer corresponding to _xTransferId

reportTx(bytes32,uint256,address,uint256.details: allows reporter to report transaction which occured on another blockchain

params._amount: amount of tokens destroyed on another blockchain
params._fromBlockchain: blockchain in which tokens were destroyed
params._txId: transactionId of transaction thats being reported
params._xTransferId: unique (if non zero) pre-determined id (unlike _txId which is determined after the transactions been mined)

restrictRegistryUpdate(bool).details: restricts the permission to update the contract-registry

params._onlyOwnerCanUpdateRegistry: indicates whether or not permission is restricted to owner only

setReporter(address,bool).details: allows the owner to set/remove reporters

params._active: true if the reporter is approved, false otherwise
params._reporter: reporter whos status is to be set

transferOwnership(address).details: allows transferring the contract ownership the new owner still needs to accept the transfer can only be called by the contract owner

upgrade(address[]).details: upgrades the contract to the latest version can only be called by the owner note that the owner needs to call acceptOwnership on the new contract after the upgrade

withdrawTokens(address,address,uint256).details: withdraws tokens held by the contract and sends them to an account can only be called by the owner

params._to: account to receive the new amount

xTransfer(bytes32,bytes32,uint256).details: claims tokens from msg.sender to be converted to tokens on another blockchain

params._amount: the amount of tokens to transfer
params._to: address to send the tokens to
params._toBlockchain: blockchain on which tokens will be issued

xTransfer(bytes32,bytes32,uint256,uint25.details: claims tokens from msg.sender to be converted to tokens on another blockchain

params._amount: the amount of tokens to transfer
params._id: pre-determined unique (if non zero) id which refers to this transaction
params._to: address to send the tokens to
params._toBlockchain: blockchain on which tokens will be issued
